intro: Tetrataenium himalayense, commonly known as the Himalayan tetrataenium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a reddish tint, especially when mature. Tetrataenium himalayense is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in alpine meadows.
